chain_of_thought: [Article Type: Case Report] In this article, I found the following liver injury-related lab values and clinical outcomes: The patient is a 79-year-old male with immune-related hepatitis during avelumab therapy. Lab results include AST, ALT, and ALP elevations graded over time, with peak values inferred from grade descriptions: AST reached grade 3 (likely >5 times upper limit of normal, ULN), ALT reached grade 2 (likely >3 times ULN), and ALP reached grade 3 (likely >5 times ULN). Bilirubin, INR, GGT, and Albumin are not explicitly mentioned in the text. The clinical outcome is death due to liver failure.

lab_results.ALT: Grade 2 elevation (likely >3 times ULN, specific peak value not provided)
lab_results.AST: Grade 3 elevation (likely >5 times ULN, specific peak value not provided)
lab_results.ALP: Grade 3 elevation (likely >5 times ULN, specific peak value not provided)
